Grammar.title: Simple word order
Grammar.description: In English, words follow a clear structure: Subject + Verb + Object + (place) + (time). This fixed order helps make sentences easy to understand.

Grammar.title: Present simple. Affirmative
Grammar.description: Affirmative sentences in the Present Simple show that something happens regularly, is generally true, or is a fact. They state information in a direct and positive way.

Grammar.title: Present Simple. Negative
Grammar.description: Negative sentences in the Present Simple show that something does not happen regularly, is not generally true, or is not a fact. They are used to say that an action, habit, or situation is absent or incorrect.
